review_title: My experience working at Midwestern University
job_title: Senior Administrative Assistant in Downers Grove, IL
pros: Short commute from my home
cons:
Nepotism 
Favoritism 
Hourly employees have to punch time clock,, so they are basically chained to their desk, while Salary employee's come and go as they please. Basic daily hours are 8:00-4:30 for EVERYONE, salary people rarely exceed 40 hr work week yet still get salary perks. While hourly employees, since they punch, they are at office full day, while salary people leve early, extra long lunches, etc. Merit increases are pre-determined, regardless if you "just get by" or if you "exceed expectations", so after awhile the hard working employees figure what is the point since they are not compensated for their good work over past year. Eventually the good people leave.

job_title: Network Engineer in Downers Grove, IL
pros: nice and easy work pace with nice people.
cons: work pace are slow and it is hard to accomplish your work by yourself.

pros: Benefits are very good as is 403(b) match

job_title: Certified Veterinary Technician in Phoenix, AZ
pros: For a technician, the pay, benefits, hours, and workload is as good as it gets. I love working with vet students.
cons: If you like to do things yourself (at a fast pace), teaching students isn’t for you. We work at the pace of their learning and they do everything. It’s not fast, but it’s very fulfilling.

pros: Work with students and learn from faculty.
cons: Lecture students and conduct research.

pros:
So far, everyone I've met here seems to really enjoy their job, and I enjoy the fact that I don't run into negativity on a daily basis. As Video Technician, part of my job is to maintain positive relationships with the staff and faculty here, and it seems like everyone has been happy to meet me.

Also, the benefits are great and the pay is great considering the very low cost of living in in Phoenix.

Overall, this position is great for me, as someone that's been operating on a freelance basis since graduating college.
cons:
I can only speak for my specific department. I work in the background, which is something I love, but for some of the people I was hired with, it seemed like they were getting hired to work very basic, dead-end type jobs. Not really a "con." Just a thought.

As for my job specifically, it seems like many of the professors want to wait for the last second to give me their paperwork for recordings. That part is fine with me, but it's disappointing when I have to turn away professors because they procrastinated.

review_title: Highly corporate environment, little faculty autonomy, lots of micromanaging
pros: Salary and benefits. Nice location but constantly (10+ years) under construction.
cons: Administration micromanages nearly every situation. Growth of institution has been exponential, but seemingly without regard for the burden on current programs. New departments get state of the art facilities; existing programs basically ignored. Decisions about resources (teaching space, offices, building design) made without consulting end-users before implementation. Very top-down corporate environment, a poor fit for academia, including strict "core business hours" which thwart faculty freedom and creativity. No attempts to facilitate faculty members' ability to maintain even a minimal a clinical practice as part of overall faculty role. Students ask about and comment on this last issue frequently.

pros: nice clothing given by President.  promotes healthy lifestyle and work/life balance.  if you are comfortable working for a supervisor who is a "puppet" and a numbskull you may be happy here.
cons: questionable practices of accounting basics...if you are comfortable working for a supervisor who is a "puppet" and a numbskull you may be happy here. HR officials DO NOT check both sides of an issue before issuing/supporting discipilinary actions...management thru gossip.  Focus energy and attention to the staff members PASSIONATE about their work and not just sittin' around crying about everything.  Don't be fooled by the "nice-nice" behaviors that you see :: and keep your mouth shut if you want to keep your job: even if regulations are being violated....caused too much anxiety for this hard working technician ("mentor").

review_title: Amazing place to work with a President/CEO that truly cares about her employees!
pros: Midwestern offers the best benefits I have ever had and they keep adding new benefits!  The President/CEO is a wonderful woman who seems to really care about her employees and consider them in every decision she makes.  Great work/life balance and love my co-workers!
cons: None as far as I am concerned.  It does seem that each department has its own culture and some departments seem to have more issues than others.  Also, some jobs seem to have limited room for advancement so if that is important to you be sure to ask about it before you take the job.

pros: Private university with continued growth while public universities downsize and furlough.  Good benefits and beautiful campus.  My department allows me a great deal of freedom to explore areas of interest and set my own schedule.  I'm valued for my contributions and encouraged to improve my skill sets.
cons: Work environment varies from college to college and even from department to department depending on supervisor.  Opportunities for advancement also vary for staff depending on department.  Some departments seem to be "favored" more than others, as do some people.

pros: Good benifits, good pay, retirement, FMLA, vacation, personal and sick days.
cons: Poor management, low employee morale, hours get moved around with no concern for employee home life, favoritism, POOR MANAGEMENT

pros: benefits and paid holidays and personal time off
cons: Upper management is biased and untrustworthy.  It seems as though they don't want to take accoutablility for their actions.  They do not e-mail to confirm desisions.  They constintantly change protocol to suit the situation at hand.

review_title: AVOID working for Midwestern University in Glendale AZ!
job_title: Salaried Employee of Six Years in Glendale, AZ
pros: Campus is nice. Students are fabulous.
cons: Horrible leadership. They have zero loyalty to long time employees. Racist and don't expect to be promoted or do well unless your director likes you. They fire people without reason, which their H.R. supports and MANY people have won lawsuits after being fired for discrimination. There are too many other great companies in the area, don't put yourself through the BS.
